summary: Website (PREMJI) for engineering college students in Tamil Nadu to access free study materials and books, organized by department and subject, with search and admin management.
known_issues: Search button click triggers an error in the UI.

existing_features.title: Create a public, mobile-friendly website that lets engineering college students browse and access free study materials and books organized by academic structure (e.g., department/branch, semester, subject).
Implement a searchable and filterable resource catalog UI so students can quickly find materials by keyword and filter by department/semester/subject/resource type.

Provide a simple admin-only management interface to add, edit, and remove resource entries, while keeping reading/downloading public (no login required for students). Use Internet Identity for admin authentication.
Apply a coherent, distinctive visual theme across the site (colors, typography, spacing, and component styling) suitable for an academic resource library. Do not use a blue+purple primary palette.
Add generated static image assets (logo and a hero illustration) under frontend/public/assets/generated and display them on the Home page and site header.
Fix the runtime error that occurs when navigating to Search and interacting with the filters so that clicking the Search entry point and using filter dropdowns never throws an exception.
Update the global header branding so the website name shown at the top of every page is “PREMJI”.
Update the global site header branding so the website name “PREMJI” is shown next to the logo on all screen sizes (not hidden on small/mobile screens).

Update the academic structure so engineering programs have exactly 8 semesters available per department by default (Semester 1 through Semester 8), and ensure Browse/Search/admin structure views reflect this updated structure.

Add an admin-facing help section in the Admin Panel that explains how an admin can upload/publish materials and add them to PREMJI using the existing “Add Resource” flow (title + public URL), including required sharing/visibility settings for links.
Add an admin UI workflow in the Admin > Resources tab to upload a file (e.g., PDF) and attach it to a selected Department/Semester/Subject as a new resource, alongside the existing external-URL flow.
Update public resource rendering so that resources backed by uploaded files open/download correctly, while external URL resources keep opening their external link.
Update the Admin Help section text to include instructions for uploading files directly in PREMJI (in addition to the existing external-hosting instructions), keeping all user-facing text in English.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a website providing free study materials and books for engineering college subjects
Add a backend data model and API for managing the study resources catalog (departments/semesters/subjects/resources) so the frontend can list and query resources.
Add Tamil Nadu engineering college departments and populate subjects under each department so the catalog is usable out of the box.
Display the website name “PREMJI” at the top (header) on all pages.
Fix the error shown when clicking the Search button in the resource catalog UI.

Pre-populate the catalog with a comprehensive set of common Tamil Nadu engineering (BE/BTech) departments/branches and include an initial semester + subject structure under each department so that the Browse and Search pages are usable without admin setup.
Show the website name “PREMJI” next to/near the logo in the global header.
Update the academic structure to reflect 8 semesters for engineering programs across departments/branches.
Seed the catalog with some initial books/materials (sample content) so the site is not empty on first use.
Provide an admin workflow/UI for uploading materials (files) and attaching them to departments/semesters/subjects/resources.
Seed the catalog with a small set of sample books/study materials (resources) across at least a few departments/semesters/subjects so that students see non-empty content on first use.
Extend the backend resource model to support file-backed materials in addition to external URLs, and expose admin-only APIs to upload and manage files.
